Filter URLS in the provided database.

Source: R/filter_urls.R
filter_urls.Rd

Filter URLS in the provided database.

filter_urls(
  topic = NULL,
  country = NULL,
  language = NULL,
  rss_table = package_rss
)

Arguments

topic

the topic of the feed see `show_topics()` for more.
country

the country of origin of the feed using two capital letters, for example "US". See `show_countries()` for more.
language

the language of the content of the feed using two lowercase letters, for example "en". See `show_languages()` for more.
rss_table

a dataframe with urls and rss feeds in case you need to construct your own out of websites not in the included database.

Value

a tibble filtered according to the given parameters

Examples

filter_urls(topic = "tech", country = "US", language = "en")
#> # A tibble: 29 x 7
#>    clean_url  language topic_unified main  clean_country rss_url      GlobalRank
#>    <chr>      <chr>    <chr>         <chr> <chr>         <chr>        <chr>     
#>  1 ycombinat… en       tech          1     US            https://new… 1157      
#>  2 wsj.com    en       tech          None  US            http://blog… 83        
#>  3 wired.com  en       tech          1     US            http://feed… 146       
#>  4 washingto… en       tech          None  US            http://feed… 86        
#>  5 usatoday.… en       tech          None  US            http://cont… 135       
#>  6 theverge.… en       tech          1     US            http://www.… 225       
#>  7 thenextwe… en       tech          None  US            http://then… 596       
#>  8 thehill.c… en       tech          None  US            http://theh… 666       
#>  9 techradar… en       tech          1     US            http://www.… 715       
#> 10 reuters.c… en       tech          None  US            http://feed… 81        
#> # … with 19 more rows
